answer:
## General Lighting Load Calculation for Office Building (CEC 2022)

**Calculation:**
- **Building area**: 5,000 sq ft
- **Unit load from Table 220.12 (Office)**: 1.3 VA/ft² (already includes 125% continuous load factor per note)
- **Formula**: 5,000 ft² × 1.3 VA/ft² = **6,500 VA**

**Citations:**
- Unit load value: CEC 2022 Table 220.12 (Office)
- Continuous load factor inclusion: CEC 2022 Table 220.12 note

[OK] Source: CEC 2022

tools_called.output:
CEC 2022 Table 220.12 - General Lighting Loads by Non-Dwelling Occupancy
Section: Article 220
Description: Provides unit lighting load values in volt-amperes per square meter and per square foot for calculating general lighting loads in non-dwelling occupancies. The 125 percent multiplier for continuous load as specified in 210.20(A) is included when using the unit loads in this table. Used to determine minimum lighting load for branch circuit and feeder calculations based on occupancy type. California amendment (delta) indicates modifications from the base NEC.

Headers: Type of Occupancy | Unit Load (Volt-amperes/m²) | Unit Load (Volt-amperes/ft²)


Occupancy: Automotive facility
  METRIC (per square meter):   16 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.5 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.5 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Convention center
  METRIC (per square meter):   15 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.4 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.4 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Courthouse
  METRIC (per square meter):   15 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.4 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.4 VA/ft²)]

  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.5 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.5 VA/ft²)]

  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.4 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Fire station

  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.3 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.3 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Gymnasium

Occupancy: Hotels and motels, including apartment houses without provisions for cooking by tenants

  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.7 VA/ft²
  Footnote: b
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.7 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Library
  METRIC (per square meter):   16 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.5 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.5 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Manufacturing facility

Occupancy: Motion picture theater

  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.6 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Museum
  METRIC (per square meter):   17 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.6 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.6 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Office
  METRIC (per square meter):   14 VA/m²

Occupancy: Parking garage

Occupancy: Penitentiary
  METRIC (per square meter):   13 VA/m²

  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.2 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Performing arts theater
  METRIC (per square meter):   16 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.5 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.5 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Police station
  METRIC (per square meter):   14 VA/m²

  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.3 VA/ft²)]

  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (2.2 VA/ft²)]

  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.5 VA/ft²
  Footnote: f
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.5 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Retail
  METRIC (per square meter):   20 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.9 VA/ft²
  Footnote: g,h
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.9 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: School/university
  METRIC (per square meter):   33 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  3 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (3 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Sports arena
  METRIC (per square meter):   33 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  3 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (3 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Town hall
  METRIC (per square meter):   15 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.4 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.4 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Transportation
  METRIC (per square meter):   13 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.2 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.2 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Warehouse
  METRIC (per square meter):   13 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.2 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.2 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Workshop
  METRIC (per square meter):   18 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.7 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.7 VA/ft²)]

Notes:
  The 125 percent multiplier for a continuous load as specified in 210.20(A) is included when using the unit loads in this table for calculating the minimum lighting load for a specified occupancy.
  Armories and auditoriums are considered gymnasium-type occupancies.
  Lodge rooms are similar to hotels and motels.
  Industrial commercial loft buildings are considered manufacturing-type occupancies.
  Banks are office-type occupancies.
  Garages — commercial (storage) are considered parking garage occupancies.
  Clubs are considered restaurant occupancies.
  Barber shops and beauty parlors are considered retail occupancies.
  Stores are considered retail occupancies.

  METRIC (per square meter):   33 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  3 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (3 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Town hall
  METRIC (per square meter):   15 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.4 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.4 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Transportation
  METRIC (per square meter):   13 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.2 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.2 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Warehouse
  METRIC (per square meter):   13 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.2 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.2 VA/ft²)]

Occupancy: Workshop
  METRIC (per square meter):   18 VA/m²
  IMPERIAL (per square foot):  1.7 VA/ft²
  [For 'square feet' questions → use IMPERIAL value (1.7 VA/ft²)]

Notes:
  The 125 percent multiplier for a continuous load as specified in 210.20(A) is included when using the unit loads in this table for calculating the minimum lighting load for a specified occupancy.
  Armories and auditoriums are considered gymnasium-type occupancies.
  Lodge rooms are similar to hotels and motels.
  Industrial commercial loft buildings are considered manufacturing-type occupancies.
  Banks are office-type occupancies.
  Garages — commercial (storage) are considered parking garage occupancies.
  Clubs are considered restaurant occupancies.
  Barber shops and beauty parlors are considered retail occupancies.
  Stores are considered retail occupancies.

[TABLE FOOTNOTES]
  [general] The 125 percent multiplier for a continuous load as specified in 210.20(A) is included when using the unit loads in this table for calculating the minimum lighting load for a specified occupancy.
  [a] Armories and auditoriums are considered gymnasium-type occupancies.
  [b] Lodge rooms are similar to hotels and motels.
  [c] Industrial commercial loft buildings are considered manufacturing-type occupancies.
  [d] Banks are office-type occupancies.
  [e] Garages — commercial (storage) are considered parking garage occupancies.
  [f] Clubs are considered restaurant occupancies.
  [g] Barber shops and beauty parlors are considered retail occupancies.
  [h] Stores are considered retail occupancies.

iterations.llm_content:
## General Lighting Load Calculation for Office Building (CEC 2022)

**Calculation:**
- **Building area**: 5,000 sq ft
- **Unit load from Table 220.12 (Office)**: 1.3 VA/ft² (already includes 125% continuous load factor per note)
- **Formula**: 5,000 ft² × 1.3 VA/ft² = **6,500 VA**

**Citations:**
- Unit load value: CEC 2022 Table 220.12 (Office)
- Continuous load factor inclusion: CEC 2022 Table 220.12 note

[OK] Source: CEC 2022

Notes:
  The 125 percent multiplier for a continuous load as specified in 210.20(A) is included when using the unit loads in this table for calculating the minimum lighting load for a specified occupancy.
  Armories and auditoriums are considered gymnasium-type occupancies.
  Lodge rooms are similar to hotels and motels.
  Industrial commercial loft buildings are considered manufacturing-type occupancies.
  Banks are office-type occupancies.
  Garages — commercial (storage) are considered parking garage occupancies.
  Clubs are considered restaurant occupancies.
  Barber shops and beauty parlors are considered retail occupancies.
  Stores are considered retail occupancies.

[TABLE FOOTNOTES]
  [general] The 125 percent multiplier for a continuous load as specified in 210.20(A) is included when using the unit loads in this table for calculating the minimum lighting load for a specified occupancy.
  [a] Armories and auditoriums are considered gymnasium-type occupancies.
  [b] Lodge rooms are similar to hotels and motels.
  [c] Industrial commercial loft buildings are considered manufacturing-type occupancies.
  [d] Banks are office-type occupancies.
  [e] Garages — commercial (storage) are considered parking garage occupancies.
  [f] Clubs are considered restaurant occupancies.
  [g] Barber shops and beauty parlors are considered retail occupancies.
  [h] Stores are considered retail occupancies.
